decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of powerful planeswalkers, card advantage engines, and board wipes. By generating card advantage and controlling the tempo of the game, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with powerful threats like Uro and Agent of Treachery. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the late game by blinking permanents for extra triggers and advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple powerful spells for free each turn while controlling the board with removal spells like Deafening Clarion and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler. Complementing these control elements are powerful threats like Sphinx of Foresight and Cavalier of Flame, which can quickly end the game if left unchecked. The deck aims to establish control early on and maintain tempo through the mid to late game, eventually overwhelming the opponent with a mix of removal, card advantage, and potent threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw, with a win condition of resolving big threats like Dream Trawler and Teferi, Time Raveler. It utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value through flickering permanents. The mana base is optimized for consistency and there are multiple sources of card advantage like Omen of the Sea and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain board control until it can close out the game with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck also includes strong threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King to quickly end the game. The inclusion of Sphinx of Foresight and Narset of the Ancient Way helps with card selection and advantage. By efficiently utilizing mana and powerful spells, the deck aims to dominate the board and overwhelm the opponent.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through removal spells and disruption. The deck aims to ramp into powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Hydroid Krasis to overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful creatures. The inclusion of cards like Casualties of War and Cavalier of Thorns provide additional flexibility and utility in dealing with a variety of threats while maintaining a strong board presence. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all three colors required for the deck's spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing small, low-cost creatures like Gutterbones and Hunted Witness to quickly build up a board presence. Combining sacrifice effects from cards like Witch's Oven and Priest of Forgotten Gods with powerful synergies like Cruel Celebrant and Cauldron Familiar allows the deck to deal damage to the opponent while generating value. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion ensures that key creatures can be returned from the graveyard, providing resilience and redundancy to the aggressive strategy. Additionally, the deck includes efficient removal and card draw to maintain momentum.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through the use of Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It utilizes a combination of board wipes like Deafening Clarion and powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of Kenrith, the Returned King provides additional utility and flexibility, while Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way offer disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through strategic resource management and timely plays.

This Jund Control deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies to control the board and generate incremental value. By combining cards like Trail of Crumbs, Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil, the deck can create a loop of sacrifice triggers to chip away at the opponent's resources while gaining card advantage. Korvold, Fae-Cursed King serves as a powerful finisher, growing in size with each sacrificed permanent. Agonizing Remorse provides disruption against the opponent's key cards, while Extinction Event helps in dealing with a wide range of threats. Liliana, Dreadhorde General offers additional card advantage and a strong board presence.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on maximizing damage output and generating value by sacrificing creatures. With cards like Witch's Oven, Claim the Firstborn, and Mayhem Devil, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage to the opponent. Utilizing the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer for additional damage, this deck is all about aggressive plays and maintaining pressure on the opponent. With a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful finishers like Judith, the Scourge Diva, this deck is designed to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells each turn without paying their mana cost, creating a strong board presence and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck includes control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Cavalier of Flame to manage the board and gain card advantage. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion allows the player to draw additional cards. The deck also includes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Deafening Clarion to deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention card to cast spells for free. It includes a variety of removal spells like Elspeth Conquers Death, Oath of Kaya, and Extinction Event to deal with threats. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by bouncing permanents back to hand. The deck includes a toolbox of cards in the sideboard for different matchups.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly by deploying a variety of low-cost creatures and countermagic spells to control the board. By using efficient creatures like Brazen Borrower and Stonecoil Serpent alongside disruptive spells like Aether Gust and Quench, the deck aims to stay ahead in tempo and maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of card draw and counter spells like Opt, Mystical Dispute, and Neutralize help to ensure the deck can keep up with the opponent's threats while maintaining its aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought Erasure and Tyrant's Scorn, while ramping up its own resources with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck can generate card advantage and life gain with Hydroid Krasis and Cavalier of Thorns, while also having a strong late-game win condition in Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The mana base is built around the three-color Sultai combination to ensure consistency and versatility in casting spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful card advantage and board control with cards like Deafening Clarion and Teferi, Time Raveler. By utilizing Fires of Invention, the deck can cast powerful spells for free, allowing for explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion adds a powerful draw engine to ensure the deck maintains resources. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and dictate the pace of the game through its control elements and powerhouse creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. It includes powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame, Bonecrusher Giant, and Sphinx of Foresight, as well as planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death to maintain board control. The deck also includes cards like Memory Leak and Brazen Borrower for disruption and tempo advantage. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently using mana and resources to eventually overwhelm them and secure the win.

The deck revolves around cycling quickly through cards to activate powerful abilities and deal damage to the opponent. By constantly cycling through cards, the deck aims to build up card advantage while also dealing direct damage through cards like Zenith Flare. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides an additional advantage by allowing for the repeated use of low-cost cycling cards. The creatures in the deck also have cycling abilities, allowing for flexibility in combat situations. Overall, the deck focuses on cycling efficiently to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats and damage.
